Votehere.af

Votehere.af enables Afghan voters to find the nearest polling center to vote in the Presidential and Provincial Council Elections on April 5, 2014. Use Votehere.af to search for the nearest polling center and the approximate distance.

How to Use The Site

There easiest way is to use the "Find Your Location" button at the bottom of your screen. If we can get your current location, we will use it to look up the closest station to where you are right now.

Your current location will appear as a grey dot. Your nearest polling station will appear as a green dot.

Alternatively you can select "Choose Your District" to zoom into a district. Move the black target to your current location. Your nearest polling station will appear as a green dot.

How to Help 1: Embed Votehere.af on you website

Are you a CSO, political party, or media organization? You can help Afghan voters find their way to the polls by sharing this application. Use the sample embeds below to share the site. Share widely.

400x400

<iframe> width="400px" height="400px" frameBorder="0" src="http://votehere.af"></iframe>

700x400

<iframe> width="700px" height="500px" frameBorder="0" src="http://votehere.af"></iframe>

How to Help 2: Improve Votehere.af

Do you see something wrong with the site? Please post any issues or suggestions.

Do you want to make Votehere.af better? Please contribute to building Votehere.af

Partners

Votehere.af is possible because of open data on Afghanistan's elections. On March 18th, the IEC published polling station locations, enabling a polling station lookup for the first time in Afghanistan's history.

Several individuals and organizations contributed to developing and distributing Votehere.af. Special thanks to:

  • @kamicut and @acrylc from Lamba Labs
  • the team at Development Seed
  • Impassion Afghanistan
  • @radproject
  • Afghanistan 1400
  • ... and others who prefer to remain nameless.

Polling center location data updated March 31, 2014. Source: IEC
